comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: From London Gazette 23 Feb 1917:  Capt B Neame Hrs from Staff Capt to DAAG 14 Feb 1917, Temp appt. LG 29958.  Then in LG 30784 of 5 Jul 1918; AAG appointments, Bt Maj B Neame Hrs from DAAG at the War Office to remain seconded and to be temp Lt Col whilst so employed effective 29 May 1918.  Post Armistice LG 31595 has Capt and Bt Maj B Neame 18th Hussars to be Major effective 6 Sep 1919; which is superseded by LG 31639 back-dating the promotion to 24 Aug 1919.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: 05 Jan 1909 The Advertiser, Adelaide, South Australia ADMIRAL BOSANQUET. 'AIDE-DE-CAMP APPOINTED. : LONDON, March 3. . Lieutenant B. Neame, of the 18th Hussars, has been appointed aide-de-camp to 'Admiral Sir Day Hort Bosanquet, the new Governor of South Australia. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/5179518 ALSO "Shortly afterwards I saw Captain Bertram Neame, the Adjutant of the 18th Hussars, who had been wounded in the right hand and arm by one of the shells . . ." near Elverdinghe (Poperinghe, Belgium) April 24, 1915 (would be early in the 2nd Battle of Ypres) as mentioned in: "With Cavalry in 1915. The British Trooper in the Trench Line. Through the Second Battle of Ypres" by FREDERIC COLEMAN, F.R.G.S. (Melbourne Australia June 1916) (Author of " From Mom to Ypres with French ") pub LONDON 1916 pp 147-148 www.archive.org/stream/withcavalryin19100coleuoft/withcav...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Major B Neame named in photograph of 4th QUEENS OWN HUSSARS taken in India Lucknow 1925/27 in possession of contributor to site www.rootschat.com/forum/index.php/topic,449067.msg1014968... ALSO Sold March 2011 online: Historical piece of campaign furniture. Solid oak chest. It bears a brass plaque stating that the owner was Major B Neame of the 18th Hussars. "This chest weighs an absolute ton." www.worthpoint.com/worthopedia/18th-hussars-cutlery-campa...

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
London Gazette has
Brigade Major—
vice Captain B.
Neame, 18th (Queen Mary's Own) Hussars.
Dated 7th September, 1915.
